channel.title: Making .java files
channel.description: When I make a .java file, do I have to put a certain code line that makes it so the .java file works, or am I just thinking of .class files? I plan on splitting my client.java up, because it's has 10x more lines than it should have, and it will organize the code so much more than it is.

item.title: Making .java files
item.dc:creator: @ilovelamp ilovelamp
item.description:
@ilovelamp wrote:

[quote=“Stupit, post:4, topic:240118”]You would go like this.
Make a text file with any name,paste or create what you want in there.Go into “File” click “Save As”
Where it says “Text Documents” change that to “All Files” And where you put your title in put the name in with the ending as “.java”
Your welcome
~Stupit[/quote]
yeah, I know that I’m not retarded, I’m just making sure I don’t have to put anything in any other files to make it run

Read full topic

item.title: Making .java files
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

You would go like this.
Make a text file with any name,paste or create what you want in there.Go into “File” click “Save As”
Where it says “Text Documents” change that to “All Files” And where you put your title in put the name in with the ending as “.java”
Your welcome
~Stupit

Read full topic

item.title: Making .java files
item.dc:creator: @ilovelamp ilovelamp
item.description:
@ilovelamp wrote:

no, what I mean is like kinda how a 508 is, split up the big sections of it, like the commands, cases etc.
